articles.title: Americans given life sentences for murder of police officer in Rome - Euronews
articles.description: Finnegan Elder and Gabriel Natale-Hjorth were jailed for life for the 2019 murder of Italian police officer Mario Cerciello Rega.
articles.content:
Two Americans have been jailed for life in Italy for the 2019 murder of a police officer. 
Finnegan Elder, 21, and Gabriel Natale-Hjorth, 20, were both handed Italy’s harshest prison sentence after … [+1704 chars]

articles.author: Bill Wyman
articles.title: Cherished American right behind social media ban on Donald Trump - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: You can’t force a company to provide service to a jerk. That is the simple truth behind the Facebook and Insta ban on the former president.
articles.content:
But that, sigh, is where we are. The Oversight Board posted its ruling on the web, using the sexy headline, FB-691QAMHJ: Case decision 2021-001-FB-FBR.
Talk about clickbait!
The report concludes th… [+1880 chars]

articles.title: Tencent said to be in talks with US to keep gaming investments - South China Morning Post
articles.description: Tencent, owner of the world’s largest gaming business, is negotiating with the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States to retain its stakes in American game developers, said sources.

articles.title: 2 Americans convicted of killing police officer in Italy and sentenced to life in prison - CBS News
articles.description: There was a gasp in the Rome courtroom as the presiding judge read the verdict.
articles.content:
A jury convicted two American friends Wednesday in the 2019 slaying of a police officer in a tragic unraveling of a small time drug deal gone bad, sentencing them to the maximum life in prison.
